page.title: 10AGRICULTURE.
page.content: The local farming is mixed: beef and dairy cattle, root crops, silage, sweet corn and other market garden produce. There are few cereals and few or no sheep. Some Ockham farms have been fragmented or sold for paddock and riding stables and some for market gardening with agricultural buildings sold separately as residences. Ugly prefabricated farm buildings escape planning controls. Some former farms have become managed estates for rough shooting:-pheasant and partridge. The Wisley farmland is now horticultural in the RHS garden (see Special Feature). Pyrford and Ripley still have some farms, thanks to the the Green Belt policy, for the land usage is under pressure with London only 30 miles away.
